New Records: Mohammed Shami will surpass two bona-fide ODI greats on the list if he takes three wickets, becoming India's most-successful World Cup wicket taker
Key Match Events: Travis Head scored 137 runs off 120 balls, with 15 fours and 4 sixes
Australia won by 6 wickets (with 42 balls remaining)
Pre-Game Insights: India have dominated the tournament so far to such an extent that their average winning margin batting first is 175 runs, and on average they have won with 64.4 balls to spare while chasing
Australia have had major scares to survive, white-hot spells to see out, and determined opposition chases to weather
India have been like the sun, and Australia like Jupiter - the next-most massive body in the solar system, but dwarfed still by the greater celestial body
Post-Match Reflections: India captain Rohit Sharma on the immense expectation on his team: 'We know the expectations, and the pressure, and the criticism. This is not just now, this has been happening since game number one. We have tried to maintain that calmness around the dressing room.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Ahmedabad pitch for this game is a used deck
There may be some dew to contend with, however, due to the early winter nip in the air in the evenings
Pat Cummins has the chance to join the Australian pantheon of World-Cup-winning captains, something he will obviously savour
